result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis L Tatum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
FTP Capias entered by RJ/Warrants.
If unable to post,  ordered to serve 10   consecutive days for contempt.  Debt will remain due and owing.
Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Travis L Tatum in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. The State files amended information in 14CF1706. Defense acknowledges receipt of same and enters NG pleas.
Upon plea to amended charge of Ct 1 in 14CF1706, Cts 2 & 4 in 15CF50, the balance are DRI. The State recommends a period of probation.
P-G to all three charges
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. 14CF1706-$500.00 + cc, RCJ=CFTS
                                     15CF50 - Ct 2 - 6 mos RCJ/CFTS - Huber for work only. Do not report late or under the influence of alc/cs. Absolute sobriety
                                                        costs, domestic abuse assess, DNA costs - 60 dtp
                                                                REPORT IN
                                                     Ct 4 - 30 days RCJ, consec to Ct 2. Costs including dom abuse, DNA costs
ZCI
allowing removal of GPS
allowing removal of GPS monitoring
ATTY Hamad files proposed stip and order. Order FWD to judge.
Status conference on January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim, SW,  (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.     Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
AMENDED 12/30/14    GPS MONITORING MAY BE REMOVED.  ALL OTHER BOND CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.
NG plea entered.
Reading waived.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Travis L Tatum in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Travis L Tatum in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
State and Defense stipulate to a signature bond. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond is modified to a $500.00 signature bond. Same conditions apply  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
